resources.string: Please read and agree to these terms and conditions of use carefully prior to accessing any materials, information, products or services.\n\n

“Affiliate” of a company means any person or other entity directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by, or under common control of such company.

 “Aqua Diviner” refers to the engineering team that developed the software or application at the University of Waterloo, ON, Canada.

 “Program” refers to the Aqua Diviner software (mobile or computer application).

 “User” refers to any persons using the software, both authorized and unauthorized.

 “SAGD” Steam Assisted Gravity Drainage, a type of well used in the production of oil.

 “Device” refers to hardware (physical or virtual) capable of running software.
Unauthorized use of the Program is not permitted, use of the Program constitutes agreement to the terms and conditions. Agreement with the terms and conditions is a requirement of authorized use.\n\n

Aqua Diviner provides the Program ‘as is’ and does guarantee any form of technical support. Including, without limitation, (i) telephone, e-mail or web-based support respecting the use of the Program (ii) program releases or corrections.

\ Aqua Diviner reserves the right to automatically install updates on the User’s Device.

To the maximum extent permitted by law, the User agrees to defend and, indemnify and hold harmless Aqua Diviner and its Affiliates from and against any and all third party claims, actions, suits or proceedings, as well as any and all losses, liabilities, damages costs and expenses (including solicitor fees) arising out of or accruing from the use to the Program.\n\n

To the maximum extent permitted by law. In no event shall Aqua Diviner or its Affiliates be liable for any damages whatsoever (including, without limitation, damages for loss of business profits, business interruption, loss of business information, or other pecuniary loss) arising out of the use of or inability to use the Program, even if Aqua Diviner has been advised of the possibility of such damages. The Program is solely an educational tool to provide the User limited information on steam behavior. It requires considerable skill and judgment to utilize the Program or interpret its results. The Program is not a substitute for engineering training, intuition, and safe practices, nor is the Program intended to provide any information beyond its educational purpose.\n\n

Considerable time, effort and expense have gone into the development of the Program, and it has been tested for defects. However, no warranty is made on its accuracy or reliability. It is the responsibility of the User to verify the results obtained from the Program. In the event the Program is found to be defective Aqua Diviner has no obligation to remedy the defect. Aqua Diviner will in no way have obligations or liabilities for incidental or consequential damages associated with the use of the Program. No other warranty is made.\n\n

The Program is owned by Aqua Diviner and is protected by Canadian copyright laws and international treaty provisions. Therefore, the User must treat the Program like any other copyrighted material (e.g., a book or musical recording) except that User may either make one (1) copy of the Program solely for backup or archival purposes, or transfer the Program to a single hard disk, provided the User keeps the original solely for backup or archival purposes. The User may not copy any written materials accompanying or associated with the Program without prior written authorization from Aqua Diviner.

 Accessing the source code of the Program and/or reverse engineering of the Program is strictly prohibited.

All notices required in this Agreement will be given in writing to all parties and delivered by registered air mail, international air courier, facsimile, or mutually agreed equivalent. Notices will be effective when received as indicated on the facsimile, registered mail or other mutually agreeable delivery receipt.

 The parties have required that this Agreement and all documents relating thereto be drawn up in English.

The pressure must be between 0.5 to 6 MPa
The flow rate must be between 0 to 12 m³/hr
The TVD must be between 0 to 500m
The Surface Casing must be between 0 to 150m
The Intermediate Casing must be between 0 to 800m
The Slotted Liner must be between 0 to 1200m
The Well Length must be between 0 to 2000m
